title: Unmanned aerial vehicle aerial spraying control

events.title: Application filed by Pyka Inc, Pyka Inc
Assigned to PYKA, INC.
description: ASSIGNMENT OF ASSIGNORS INTEREST (SEE DOCUMENT FOR DETAILS).
Assignors: Wurft, Tobias, PETERSEN, Jason, MOORE, KYLE, NORCIA, MICHAEL, OGUNWOLE, Chukwuma, RINI, Garrett, WHITE, NATHAN

classifications.description: Control of position, course, altitude or attitude of land, water, air or space vehicles, e.g. using automatic pilots involving pointing a payload, e.g. camera, weapon, sensor, towards a fixed or moving target

Dropping or releasing powdered, liquid, or gaseous matter, e.g. for fire-fighting by spraying, e.g. insecticides
Propulsion using external fans or propellers

Pointing payloads towards fixed or moving targets
UAVs specially adapted for particular uses or applications for releasing liquids or powders in-flight, e.g. crop-dusting
UAVs characterised by their flight controls autonomous, i.e. by navigating independently from ground or air stations, e.g. by using inertial navigation systems [INS]

UAVs characterised by their flight controls autonomous, i.e. by navigating independently from ground or air stations, e.g. by using inertial navigation systems [INS] using satellite radio beacon positioning systems, e.g. GPS

abstract: Methods, systems, and apparatus, including computer programs encoded on computer storage media, for controlling spraying of chemicals by an unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV). An unmanned aerial vehicle system includes one or more processors configured to perform operations of autonomously performing a flight path by the UAV and dispersing a chemical by the UAV along portions of the flight path. The UAV may include a chemical spray system having one or more spray booms with multiple nozzles for dispersing a chemical. The chemical spray system may include one or more tanks attached to the body of the UAV and a pump fluidly connected to the tanks to disperse chemical via the spray booms.
claims:
1. An unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV) system comprising one or more processors comprising hardware, the one or more processors configured to perform operations comprising:
autonomously performing a flight path by the UAV; dispersing a chemical along portions of the flight path; and wherein the UAV includes a chemical spray system which comprises:
one or more spray booms attached to a body of the UAV, the spray booms having multiple nozzles including a rotary atomizer for dispersing the chemical at different droplet sizes:
one or more tanks attached to the body of the UAV; and
a pump fluidly connected to the tanks and the spray booms.
2. (canceled)

3. The UAV system of claim 1, further comprising the operations of:
generate a flight plan for autonomously flying a flight path, the flight plan having geo-spatial based commands for controlling spraying operations; autonomously perform by the UAV at least a portion of the flight path according the flight plan; periodically determine a geo-spatial location of the UAV; determine that the UAV is near a first location of one of the geo-spatial based commands; perform by the UAV, a first geo-spatial command, wherein the first geo-spatial command instructs the UAV to begin spraying; determine that the UAV is near a second location of one of the geo-spatial based commands; and perform by the UAV, the second geo-spatial command, wherein the second geo-spatial command instructions the UAV to stop spraying.

4. The UAV system of claim 1, further comprising the operations of:
set the spray boom to disperse a chemical at a first droplet size; disperse chemical at the first droplet size along a flight path of the UAV; determine the occurrence of a physical obstacle along the flight path of the UAV; in response to the determining the occurrence of a physical object along the flight path of the UAV, cause the UAV to ascend in altitude; adjust the spray boom to disperse chemical at a second droplet size larger than the first droplet size; cause the UAV to disperse the chemical at the second droplet size while the UAV ascends in altitude; and cause the UAV to cease dispersing the chemical.

5. The UAV system of claim 1, further comprising the operations of:
set a spray boom to disperse a chemical at a first droplet size; disperse chemical at the first droplet size along a flight path of the UAV; determine a geo-spatial position of the UAV; in response to the determining the geo-spatial position of the UAV along the flight path, set the spray boom to disperse chemical at a second droplet size different than the first droplet size; cause the UAV to disperse the chemical at the second droplet size along the flight path; and cause the UAV to cease dispersing the chemical.

6. The UAV system of claim 1, further comprising the operations of:
obtain a first air temperature at a first altitude; cause the UAV to disperse chemical along a flight path of the UAV; obtain a second air temperature at second altitude; determine the likelihood of a temperature inversion by comparing the first and second temperatures; and if a temperature inversion is determined likely to exist, then cause the UAV to cease dispersing the chemical.

7. The UAV system of claim 1, further comprising the operations of:
autonomously perform a flight path; disperse chemical along the flight path; periodically determine the occurrence of a spraying cessation event, wherein the spraying cessation event is a determined temperature inversion; cease dispersing the chemical if the occurrence of a spraying cessation event has been determined; determine whether to resume spraying of the chemical; and resume spraying of the chemical along the flight path.

8. The UAV system of claim 1, further comprising the operations of:
autonomously perform a flight path, wherein the UAV has one or more motors connected to operating spinning propellers; cease rotation of one or more motors of the UAV, the motors connected to propellers; disperse chemical along the flight path; cease dispersing the chemical along the flight path; and start rotation of the one or more ceased more of the UAV thereby providing forward thrust to the UAV.

9. A method performed by an unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV) system comprising one or more processors comprising hardware, the one or more processors configured to perform operations comprising:
autonomously performing a flight path by the UAV; disperse a chemical along portions of the flight path; and wherein the UAV includes a chemical spray system which comprises one or more spray booms having multiple nozzles for dispersing the chemical, one or more tanks attached to the body of the UAV, a pump fluidly connected to the tanks and the spray booms; and wherein the multiple nozzles include a rotary atomizer, and wherein the one or more spray booms are attached to a body of the UAV.
10. (canceled)

11. The method of claim 9, further comprising the operations of:
generate a flight plan for autonomously flying a flight path, the flight plan having geo-spatial based commands for controlling spraying operations; autonomously perform by the UAV at least a portion of the flight path according the flight plan; periodically determine a geo-spatial location of the UAV; determine that the UAV is near a first location of one of the geo-spatial based commands; perform by the UAV, a first geo-spatial command, wherein the first geo-spatial command instructs the UAV to begin spraying; determine that the UAV is near a second location of one of the geo-spatial based commands; and perform by the UAV, the second geo-spatial command, wherein the second geo-spatial command instructions the UAV to stop spraying.

12. The method of claim 9, further comprising the operations of:
set the spray boom to disperse a chemical at a first droplet size; disperse chemical at the first droplet size along a flight path of the UAV; determine the occurrence of a physical obstacle along the flight path of the UAV; in response to the determining the occurrence of a physical object along the flight path of the UAV, cause the UAV to ascend in altitude; adjust the spray boom to disperse chemical at a second droplet size larger than the first droplet size; cause the UAV to disperse the chemical at the second droplet size while the UAV ascends in altitude; and cause the UAV to cease dispersing the chemical.

13. The method of claim 9, further comprising the operations of:
set a spray boom to disperse a chemical at a first droplet size; disperse chemical at the first droplet size along a flight path of the UAV; determining a geo-spatial position of the UAV; in response to the determining the geo-spatial position of the UAV along the flight path, set the spray boom to disperse chemical at a second droplet size different than the first droplet size; cause the UAV to disperse the chemical at the second droplet size along the flight path; and cause the UAV to cease dispersing the chemical.

14. The method of claim 9, further comprising the operations of:
obtain a first air temperature at a first altitude; cause the UAV to disperse chemical along a flight path of the UAV; obtain a second air temperature at second altitude; determine the likelihood of a temperature inversion by comparing the first and second temperatures; and if a temperature inversion is determined likely to exist, then cause the UAV to cease dispersing the chemical.

15. The method of claim 9, further comprising the operations of:
autonomously perform a flight path; disperse chemical along the flight path; periodically determine the occurrence of a spraying cessation event, wherein the spraying cessation event is a determined temperature inversion; cease dispersing the chemical if the occurrence of a spraying cessation event has been determined; determine whether to resume spraying of the chemical; and resume spraying of the chemical along the flight path.

16. The method of claim 9, further comprising the operations of:
autonomously perform a flight path, wherein the UAV has one or more motors connected to operating spinning propellers; cease rotation of one or more motors of the UAV, the motors connected to propellers; disperse chemical along the flight path; cease dispersing the chemical along the flight path; and start rotation of the one or more ceased more of the UAV thereby providing forward thrust to the UAV.

17. A computer storage medium comprising instructions that when executed by one or more process included of an unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV) system, cause the system to perform the operations comprising:
autonomously performing a flight path by the UAV; dispersing a chemical along portions of the flight path; and wherein the UAV includes a chemical spray system which comprises one or more spray booms having multiple nozzles for dispersing the chemical; and wherein the UAV further comprises: one or more tanks attached to the body of the UAV; a pump fluidly connected to the tanks and the spray booms; and wherein the multiple nozzles include a rotary atomizer, and wherein the one or more spray booms are attached to a body of the UAV.
18. (canceled)

19. The computer storage medium of any of claims 17-18, wherein the operations further comprise:
generate a flight plan for autonomously flying a flight path, the flight plan having geo-spatial based commands for controlling spraying operations; autonomously perform by the UAV at least a portion of the flight path according the flight plan; periodically determine a geo-spatial location of the UAV; determine that the UAV is near a first location of one of the geo-spatial based commands; perform by the UAV, a first geo-spatial command, wherein the first geo-spatial command instructs the UAV to begin spraying; determine that the UAV is near a second location of one of the geo-spatial based commands; and perform by the UAV, the second geo-spatial command, wherein the second geo-spatial command instructions the UAV to stop spraying.

20. The computer storage medium of claim 19, wherein the operations further comprise:
set the spray boom to disperse a chemical at a first droplet size; disperse chemical at the first droplet size along a flight path of the UAV; determine the occurrence of a physical obstacle along the flight path of the UAV; in response to the determining the occurrence of a physical object along the flight path of the UAV, cause the UAV to ascend in altitude; adjust the spray boom to disperse chemical at a second droplet size larger than the first droplet size; cause the UAV to disperse the chemical at the second droplet size while the UAV ascends in altitude; and cause the UAV to cease dispersing the chemical.

21. The computer storage medium of claim 19, wherein the operations further comprise:
set a spray boom to disperse a chemical at a first droplet size; disperse chemical at the first droplet size along a flight path of the UAV; determining a geo-spatial position of the UAV; in response to the determining the geo-spatial position of the UAV along the flight path, set the spray boom to disperse chemical at a second droplet size different than the first droplet size; cause the UAV to disperse the chemical at the second droplet size along the flight path; and cause the UAV to cease dispersing the chemical.

22. The computer storage medium of claim 19, wherein the operations further comprise:
obtain a first air temperature at a first altitude; cause the UAV to disperse chemical along a flight path of the UAV; obtain a second air temperature at second altitude; determine the likelihood of a temperature inversion by comparing the first and second temperatures; and if a temperature inversion is determined likely to exist, then cause the UAV to cease dispersing the chemical.

23. The computer storage medium of claim 19, wherein the operations further comprise:
autonomously perform a flight path; disperse chemical along the flight path; periodically determine the occurrence of a spraying cessation event, wherein the spraying cessation event is a determined temperature inversion; cease dispersing the chemical if the occurrence of a spraying cessation event has been determined; determine whether to resume spraying of the chemical; and resume spraying of the chemical along the flight path.

24. The computer storage medium of claim 19, wherein the operations further comprise:
autonomously perform a flight path, wherein the UAV has one or more motors connected to operating spinning propellers; cease rotation of one or more motors of the UAV, the motors connected to propellers; disperse chemical along the flight path; cease dispersing the chemical along the flight path; and start rotation of the one or more ceased more of the UAV thereby providing forward thrust to the UAV.
